content:
ObjectListCommandCollection Class

Definition

Represents a collection of ObjectListCommand objects. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
public class ObjectListCommandCollection : System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ArrayListCollectionBase, System.Web.UI.IStateManager
Inheritance
Object
ArrayListCollectionBase
ObjectListCommandCollection
Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
ToString()
CopyTo(Array, Int32)
Count
GetEnumerator()
IsReadOnly
IsSynchronized
Items
SyncRoot

Examples

For a complete example, see the ObjectList overview.

Remarks

The class object provides the container for the commands of an ObjectList. Accessing the Commands property of an ObjectList retrieves an ObjectListCommandCollection object. An application can programmatically add or remove commands.

The ObjectListCommandCollection class implements the ICollection interface through the ArrayListCollectionBase class.

Properties

IsTrackingViewState

Gets a value indicating whether the collection is tracking view-state changes. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected bool IsTrackingViewState { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if tracking view-state changes; otherwise, false.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Item(Int32)

Returns an ObjectListCommand item in the collection for the specified index. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand this[int index] { get; }
Parameters
index
Int32

The index of the item to get.

Value
ObjectListCommand

The ObjectListCommand item at the specified index.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Methods

Add(ObjectListCommand)

Adds a command to the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void Add (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand command);
Parameters
command
ObjectListCommand

The command to add to the end of the collection.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

AddAt(Int32, ObjectListCommand)

Adds a command at the location in the collection specified by the index parameter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void AddAt (int index, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand command);
Parameters
index
Int32

The location in the collection at which to add command.

command
ObjectListCommand

The ObjectListCommand to add to the collection.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

A value of -1 for the index parameter specifies that the command is added to the end of the collection.

Clear()

Clears the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void Clear ();
Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

This method is not available in the read-only IObjectListFieldCollection interface.

You can use the Clear method for all the classes where this method applies. For example, the Clear method for a StyleSheet collection clears all the styles in the collection. For the DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection, it clears all the choices in the collection.

Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.

IndexOf(String)

Returns the index of the command whose name is the specified string. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public int IndexOf (string s);
Parameters
s
String

A string to search for in the collection.

Returns
Int32

The index of the command whose name is the specified string.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

Returns the index of the command whose Name property is the string specified by the s parameter. If matching items are not found in the collection, the IndexOf method returns -1.

LoadViewState(Object)

Loads the previously saved view state to the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected void LoadViewState (object state);
Parameters
state
Object

The object containing the view-state information to be loaded.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remove(String)

Removes the command with the specified name. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void Remove (string s);
Parameters
s
String

The name of the command to remove. This method removes the first command that matches this value in the collection.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the command at the specified index. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void RemoveAt (int index);
Parameters
index
Int32

The index number of the command to remove.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

SaveViewState()

Saves the changes to a server control's view state to an Object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected object SaveViewState ();
Returns
Object

A Object that contains the view-state information.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

TrackViewState()

Instructs the collection to track changes to its view state. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected void TrackViewState ();
Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Explicit Interface Implementations

IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState

For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

bool System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if view state changes are being tracked; otherwise, false.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ObjectListCommandCollection instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.

IStateManager.LoadViewState(Object)

For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IStateManager.LoadViewState*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Parameters
state

An object representing the state to be loaded.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ObjectListCommandCollection instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.

IStateManager.SaveViewState()

For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IStateManager.SaveViewState*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

object IStateManager.SaveViewState ();
Returns
Object

Returns an object that contains the view state changes, if any, or null if there are no changes.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ObjectListCommandCollection instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.

IStateManager.TrackViewState()

For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

void IStateManager.TrackViewState ();
Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ObjectListCommandCollection instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.
